item.title: Eurozone Government Bond Market May Be Showing Signs of Fatigue
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields dropped with the 10-year German Bund yield moving further below the 3% mark, suggesting “certain fatigue tendencies of the bond-negative momentum,” LBBW said.

item.title: Shein Buys Missguided From Frasers
item.description: Shein agreed to buy online fashion label Missguided from Frasers for an undisclosed sum, with the transaction being for the intellectual property and trademarks of the brand.

item.title: Omnicom Buys E-Commerce Shop Flywheel Digital for $835 Million
item.description: Flywheel aims to help brands sell on digital marketplaces and is part of Ascential, owner of the Cannes Lions ad festival.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 1.0%, Dragged by Auto, Pharma Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by weakness in auto and pharmaceutical stocks, amid growing concerns about the Middle East conflict and its impact on the global economy.

item.title: IFF to Sell Cosmetics Ingredients Unit to Clariant for $810 Million
item.description: Swiss chemicals company Clariant will buy a cosmetic ingredients unit of International Flavors & Fragrances for $810 million.

item.title: U.K. Home Prices Fall Became More Widespread in October
item.description: The U.K. housing market saw widespread price falls in September, as higher mortgage rates and cost-of-living pressures squeezed buyer budgets across most local markets, according to new research published by Zoopla.

item.title: Evergrande Winding-Up Hearing Adjourned to Dec. 4
item.description: China Evergrande has been given another chance to restructure its billions of dollars in debt as a court adjourned a hearing to wind up the company.

item.title: BHP Iron Ore Train Drivers Threaten Strike Action
item.description: Train drivers at BHP Group’s Australian iron-ore operations have voted in favor of strike action in a dispute over pay and conditions.

item.title: HSBC's Third-Quarter Net Profit More Than Doubled
item.description: The Asia-focused lender also intends to initiate a further share buyback of up to $3 billion after announcing three share buybacks in 2023 totaling up to $7 billion.

item.title: SGD Strengthens, Buoyed by Recovering Risk Appetite
item.description: SGD strengthened against USD in the afternoon Asian session, buoyed by recovering risk appetite spurred by gains in U.S. stock-index futures.

item.title: Singapore's Growth Likely to Be Closer to Potential Rate Next Year, MAS Says
item.description: Singapore’s gross-domestic-product growth is expected to be in the lower half of the 0.5%-1.5% forecast range this year, and closer to its potential rate next year, the Monetary Authority of Singapore said Monday.

item.title: Peltz's Push for Disney Board Seats Boosted by Perlmutter's Shares
item.description: Former Marvel Entertainment executive Ike Perlmutter says he can ‘no longer watch the business underachieve its great potential.’

item.title: Americans are still on a prolonged spending spree fueled by a strong labor market, savings and rising home values, confounding economists' expectations of a recession.
item.description: Americans are still on a prolonged spending spree fueled by a strong labor market, savings and rising home values, confounding economists’ expectations of a recession.

item.title: With both Israel and Ukraine at war, arms contractors are under pressure to step up production as Western officials worry the two countries could face a weapons shortage.
item.description: With both Israel and Ukraine at war, arms contractors are under pressure to step up production as Western officials worry the two countries could face a weapons shortage.

item.title: Bitcoin has touched its highest level since May 2022 in a head-scratching rally that follows a summer of low volatility and trading volumes.
item.description: Bitcoin has touched its highest level since May 2022 in a head-scratching rally that follows a summer of low volatility and trading volumes.

item.title: TikTok is asking managers across the world to give more employees lower ratings in performance reviews,a move that staff fear could reduce bonuses and lead to layoffs.
item.description: TikTok is asking managers across the world to give more employees lower ratings in performance reviews, a move that staff fear could reduce bonuses and lead to layoffs.

item.title: Pence dropped out of the race for the Republican presidential nomination after he struggled to gain traction in a field dominated by Trump.
item.description: Pence dropped out of the race for the Republican presidential nomination after he struggled to gain traction in a field dominated by Trump.

item.title: Investors are pouring billions of dollars into a battered long-dated Treasury bond fund operated by BlackRock in an apparent bet that yields have peaked.
item.description: Investors are pouring billions of dollars into a battered long-dated Treasury bond fund operated by BlackRock in an apparent bet that yields have peaked.

item.title: The number of migrants from India illegally crossing the U.S. border has more than doubled, many of them asylum-seekers who oppose Modi.
item.description: The number of migrants from India illegally crossing the U.S. border has more than doubled, many of them asylum-seekers who oppose Modi.

item.title: Undergraduate students working in dorms, libraries and dining halls are increasingly pushing to unionize.
item.description: Undergraduate students working in dorms, libraries and dining halls are increasingly pushing to unionize.
